intro: Phalangium liliago var. font-queri, commonly known as the Fontqueri's lily, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Liliaceae family, characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers and strap-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with six petals and a distinctive, elongated shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
